hanzi-su-wiki:
拙

Значения

Плохой, неумелый

Мнемоника

Неумелый или небрежный. Все валится 出 у него из рук 扌.

purpleculture_info:
Antonyms: 巧
Pictophonetic: 出 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
笨拙 [ bèn zhuō ]: clumsy; awkward; stupid
拙劣 [ zhuō liè ]: clumsy; botched
弄巧成拙 [ nòng qiǎo chéng zhuō ]: to overreach oneself; to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
稚拙 [ zhì zhuō ]: young and clumsy; childish and awkward
拙作 [ zhuō zuò ]: my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.); my humble writing
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 出 [ chū ] to go out, to send out; stand; produce
koohiiStory1: With fingers fumbling around trying to get the key in the door so he could exit, the bungling husband woke his wife as he tried to leave for a rendezvous with his mistress.
koohiiStory2: Horror movie cliche 769: Bungling victim´s fingers fumble & bungle trying to open the exit door.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You have to use your fingers to make an exit because you're so clumsy. You can't seem to get the door to open, your hands just slip around on the nob uselessly. Instead, you take your fingers and stick them into the door frame, pulling the whole thing off the hinges so you can leave.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Of course, you're too clumsy to do that right either, you accidentally threw the door backwards and hurt some people...
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After you make your clumsy mistake you realize that these doors come in sets (せつ). And now you have to try to open another door. And another door. So many sets of doors!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine trying to use your clumsy fingers all over the sets of doors. You keep falling over and hurting yourself. Why is it so hard to leave?!
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 咄 (はなし、トツ щелчок языком; речь), не путать: 屈 (かがむ、クツ гнуться).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if you use your hands (扌) to go out (出) you're bungling
humanum_full_description_en:
From " hand ", " out " sound. The original meaning is dull and clumsy, as opposed to " smart ". "Said Wen": "Clumsy, unfortunately. From the hand, speak out." "Guang Ya. Interpretation of "Three": "Clumsy, blunt." Such as "Laozi. Chapter Forty-Fifth": "Brightness is like a bend, great skill is like clumsy, and great argument is no good." "Han Feizi. "The main way": "If you don't do things by yourself, you know clumsy and ingenuity, and you don't think about yourself but you know blessing and blame."

" Clumsy " can be used as an expression of self-humility. For example, Tao Yuanming of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Guiyuan Tianju": "Opening up wasteland in the south, guarding the awkwardness and returning to the countryside." Tang Taizong "Answers to the Book Edict of Master Yuan Zang's Entry into the Western Regions": "I am simple in learning and clumsy in mind. How can you look up and test."

" Clumsy " also means crudeness, such as Lu Guimeng of the Tang Dynasty "Jiu Zun": "Gold is luxury, and white stone is too clumsy." It also means unsatisfactory and unlucky, such as Du Fu's "Beizheng": "Men thinks about Taoyuan, I sigh my life experience. clumsy."
humanum_short_description_en: From " hand ", " out " sound. The original meaning is dull and clumsy, as opposed to " smart ".
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「出」聲。本義是愚鈍、笨拙，與「巧」相對。《說文》：「拙，不巧也。从手，出聲。」《廣雅．釋詁三》：「拙，鈍也。」如《老子．第四十五章》：「大直若屈，大巧若拙，大辯若訥。」《韓非子．主道》：「不自操事而知拙與巧，不自計慮而知福與咎。」

　　「拙」可用為自謙之辭。如東晉陶淵明〈歸園田居〉：「開荒南野際，守拙歸田園。」唐太宗〈答元奘法師進西域記書詔〉：「朕學淺心拙，在物猶迷，況佛教幽微，豈能仰測。」

　　「拙」也表示粗劣，如唐代陸龜蒙〈酒尊〉：「黃金即為侈，白石又太拙。」亦表示不順、倒霉，如杜甫〈北征〉：「緬思桃源內，益歎身世拙。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「出」聲。本義是愚鈍、笨拙，與「巧」相對。

從「 手 」，「 出 」聲。本義是愚鈍、笨拙，與「 巧 」相對。《說文》：「拙，不巧也。从手，出聲。」《廣雅．釋詁三》：「拙，鈍也。」如《老子．第四十五章》：「大直若屈，大巧若拙，大辯若訥。」《韓非子．主道》：「不自操事而知拙與巧，不自計慮而知福與咎。」 「 拙 」可用為自謙之辭。如東晉陶淵明〈歸園田居〉：「開荒南野際，守拙歸田園。」唐太宗〈答元奘法師進西域記書詔〉：「朕學淺心拙，在物猶迷，況佛教幽微，豈能仰測。」 「 拙 」也表示粗劣，如唐代陸龜蒙〈酒尊〉：「黃金即為侈，白石又太拙。」亦表示不順、倒霉，如杜甫〈北征〉：「緬思桃源內，益歎身世拙。」
From " hand", " out" sound. The original meaning is dull and clumsy, as opposed to " smart". "Said Wen": "Clumsy, unfortunately. From the hand, speak out." "Guang Ya. Interpretation of "Three": "Clumsy, blunt." Such as "Laozi. Chapter Forty-Fifth": "Brightness is like a bend, great skill is like clumsy, and great argument is no good." "Han Feizi. "The main way": "If you don't do things by yourself, you know clumsy and ingenuity, and you don't think about yourself but you know blessing and blame." " Clumsy" can be used as an expression of self-humility. For example, Tao Yuanming of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Guiyuan Tianju": "Opening up wasteland in the south, guarding the awkwardness and returning to the countryside." Tang Taizong "Answers to the Book Edict of Master Yuan Zang's Entry into the Western Regions": "I am simple in learning and clumsy in mind. How can you look up and test." " Clumsy" also means crudeness, such as Lu Guimeng of the Tang Dynasty "Jiu Zun": "Gold is luxury, and white stone is too clumsy." It also means unsatisfactory and unlucky, such as Du Fu's "Beizheng": "Men thinks about Taoyuan, I sigh my life experience. clumsy."

拙字的基本解释

拙
zhuō
笨，不灵巧：笨拙。弄巧成拙。拙劣。
谦辞，称自己的：拙作。拙见。拙笔。拙著。
巧

拙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuō］
［《廣韻》職悦切，入薛，章。］
“炪1”的被通假字。
(1)笨拙；迟钝。
(2)自谦之辞。
(3)粗劣。
(4)困穷；倒霉。
(5)犹言不善于。
(6)质朴自然。
(7)卷曲。
(8)屈辱；屈抑。
(9)通“趉”。外出，逃走。

拙字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　拙； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页426第07
〔古文〕䂐【唐韻】職悅切。【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】朱劣切，?音梲。讀若專入聲。【說文】不巧也。【書·周官】作僞心勞日拙。【老子·道德經】大巧若拙。【戰國策】敎人而不能，則謂之拙。　又【釋名】屈也。使物否屈，不爲用也。【史記·范睢傳】楚之鐵劒利，而倡優拙。

拙字的源字形

拙字的起名意思

1、笨，不灵巧；2、谦词：拙见。

Radicals: 扌, 出  (fingers, exit)
Meaning Mnemonic
You have to use your fingers to make an exit because you're so clumsy. You can't seem to get the door to open, your hands just slip around on the nob uselessly. Instead, you take your fingers and stick them into the door frame, pulling the whole thing off the hinges so you can leave.
Of course, you're too clumsy to do that right either, you accidentally threw the door backwards and hurt some people...
Reading Mnemonic
After you make your clumsy mistake you realize that these doors come in sets (せつ). And now you have to try to open another door. And another door. So many sets of doors!
Imagine trying to use your clumsy fingers all over the sets of doors. You keep falling over and hurting yourself. Why is it so hard to leave?!
